diff --git a/.project-roadmap/issues-db/upstream/1739.json b/.project-roadmap/issues-db/upstream/1739.json
index 626313be8..6dd1d7c40 100644
--- a/.project-roadmap/issues-db/upstream/1739.json
+++ b/.project-roadmap/issues-db/upstream/1739.json
@@ -12,12 +12,19 @@
   "created_at": "2020-04-24T18:56:26Z",
   "github_updated_at": "2026-02-10T11:50:48Z",
   "body_snippet": "I'd love to be able to use mRemoteNG to handle libvirt/QEMU SPICE protocol.  That would allow connections to libvirt/QEMU VMs even if there was some reason that networking was not working within the VM.  OS installs, upgrades, etc.  Oddball OSes that you don't know whether there's remote access.  Or, diagnosing networking issues in the VM.\r\n\r\nIt seems like it would slot in well with the mRemoteNG's ethos.\r\n",
-  "our_status": "new",
-  "priority": null,
+  "our_status": "triaged",
+  "priority": "P3-enhancement",
   "target_release": null,
   "our_branch": null,
   "our_pr": null,
-  "iterations": [],
+  "iterations": [
+    {
+      "seq": 1,
+      "date": "2026-02-20",
+      "type": "triaged",
+      "description": "SPICE protocol support is a valid feature request for KVM/Proxmox users; can be implemented as an external tool integration launching virt-viewer/remote-viewer"
+    }
+  ],
   "comments": [
     {
       "id": "MDEyOklzc3VlQ29tbWVudDYyNDg3NjgwNA==",
@@ -160,5 +167,5 @@
   "needs_action": true,
   "waiting_for_us": true,
   "last_synced": "2026-02-15T09:52:50Z",
-  "notes": ""
+  "notes": "AI triage (claude): SPICE protocol support is a valid feature request for KVM/Proxmox users; can be implemented as an external tool integration launching virt-viewer/remote-viewer\nApproach: Add SPICE as a new protocol type that launches external virt-viewer (remote-viewer.exe) with connection parameters, similar to how PuTTY/external tools are integrated. Requires new ProtocolType enum value, connection info fields (host, port, TLS, password), and UI settings page entry."
 }
